website_summaries.verdict: A top-notch finish screwdriver, though it doesn't perform as well under load, making drilling into harder materials a chore.
pros: Torque settings go low enough to use on electronics
Lightweight and powerful w/good ergonomics, LED light, and fast recharge
cons: Articulating handle doesn’t lock into position, making it hard to accurately bear down on a screw
A few reports of the gear box breaking under heavy load

customer_reviews.title: Its the same product as the Hitachi
customer_reviews.text: It's literally the same product as the Hitachi, with the label saying Metabo brand. I have the Hitachi and I was looking to buy one more, I didn't realize that it was a different brand from the picture. I bought it and when I got it I was surprised that it said Metabo on it. So I decided to return it. After I filled the return slip, I compared it and realized that it is the same product just with a different brand name on it. Now I don't want to return it, and I don't know how to cancel the return. lol.
customer_reviews.author: esmaeil

customer_reviews.title: Well done Metabo (Hitachi)
customer_reviews.text: I used this at work today. I had the red color brand version. The red version was over double the price and failed in two weeks. I like the feel of the rubber coating on the Metabo and the clutch is better than the red brand. Only drawback is no battery level indicator however it does come with a light. This is a bargain. Tears down and assembles laptops in seconds. This tool is not for building a deck in the backyard with 6" lag bolts. This is for assembly, repair, teardown and light/medium work. It feels solid and it is a professional grade tool. 8 month update - Still going strong at work. Cameras, Laptops, Large Projectors, misc.
customer_reviews.author: philandcandice

customer_reviews.title: Broke under load
customer_reviews.text: Having not been pleased with the other options I found locally, I purchased this screwdriver in the hopes it would be better quality than the rest. I found the tool to be solidly built with a good balance and feel and enough torque to do the job. The lithium batteries are a big plus with enough power to last of a few hours at a time. The more I used the screwdriver the more I liked it ... until yesterday when I set the clutch on 23 and engaged the low range. The gear box broke. Now to figure out how the warranty works.
customer_reviews.author: Mace

customer_reviews.title: Nascar pit crew wannabe
customer_reviews.text: I fix copiers, servers, computer work stations. This is very handy, and fast. My work flow has been cut in half because i'm able to dismantle machines far faster than using a #2 screwdriver. The torque adjustment is awesome, and the battery life last surprisingly long. It's great it includes to. This is the best tool I have ever bought for myself for work and projects at home. I only regret not having one sooner.
customer_reviews.author: Altavista785

customer_reviews.title: Replacement for Hitachi
customer_reviews.text: I had an Hitachi cordless screw driver for years that I liked so much I bought them for other as Christmas presents, When mine stopped working after 8-10 years I went looking for a replacement and found Hitachi no longer made the cordless drill under their name. It is now being produced by Metabo. Same drill , charger, batteries and case as the Hitachi which is nice since the original batteries and charger I had still worked great and can be used with the Metabo. Seems to be the same build quality too.
customer_reviews.author: Mike D

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic so far
customer_reviews.text: Just got the tool from Amazon. Man, did it arrive fast! The tool itself is standing up to its promises really well. Light and well balanced. Lots of torque. The lock setting is really handy. The LED switch is a great feature as you can get light without engaging the motor. My only nit, and it's a small one, is that I wish there were 2 LED's on each side of the chuck to give better illumination. It's a great tool overall
customer_reviews.author: pablo86

customer_reviews.title: Hitachi DB3DL2
customer_reviews.text: I have used this driver only a few times but I like it. It is very light and has enough power for the light jobs I do with it. They mitigated the inside pinch problem w/ some soft rubber. The 2 batteries are a plus and last a long time. I wish the handle would lock into position but it not a big deal that it doesn't. The clutches work well. I would recommend and buy again. I like that the light can be turned on w/ a separate switch instead of being trigger activated.
customer_reviews.author: Hue G

customer_reviews.title: Great screwdriver with lots of torque
customer_reviews.text: Has an old hitachi model that was dropped one time too many times. Bought the dewalt version which turned out to be inconvenient and had less torque and less battery life. The dewalt gyro worked but was awkward in tight spaces. The metabo has a low and high speed. At high the torque seems the same as the dewalt. The low speed has a lot more torque. The dewalt is single speed. I like the dewalt when I don't need a lot torque. The metabo is my goto screwdriver. I gave the dewalt away.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bigger than expected
customer_reviews.text: Was looking for a small mobile screwdriver for taking apart PC's and unscrewing the small nuts. This is a bit bigger than I expected otherwise the device seems well put together. The LED light and charging station is pretty helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Jon L

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This is my go to driver when ever I need one. I have had several of these over the years and always end up getting another. I have never had one break, I have had them disappear! I have found they will torque a screw head right off if your not careful. Battery life is excellent also! I really like the fact it comes with two batteries and a stand-alone charger. Makes life so much simpler!
customer_reviews.author: This Tech Guy

customer_reviews.title: Not a reliable tool.
customer_reviews.text: One of the worst electric tools I’ve ever owned. I’ve used it twice and the other times—the batteries were always dead right after charging. Maybe I received two bad batteries or a bad charger. Overall, a very unreliable unit and for the money I spent on it—I expected better reliability. My $15 electric tools have been more reliable and functional. I would highly recommend that you look elsewhere if you want reliability.
customer_reviews.author: MKENDALL

customer_reviews.title: Ergonomics Suck
customer_reviews.text: Location of the power actuation switch really sucks. Steer clear and stay with the pistol-grip screwdrivers.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Floyd

customer_reviews.title: A brand new tool that obviously was defective from the factory and the inability of Amazon personnel to perform a simple replacement has left a bad feeling in this long time Amazon shopper
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointing. Tool was found to have a broken switch directly out of the case. It would only operate in reverse and not forward. I had to make a trip to the UPS Store to ship it back. I contacted Amazon for a replacement. Instead of sending me a replacement cordless screwdriver they sent me the tool accessory kit that included bits, pliers, allen wrenches, etc. So that required me to make a second trip to the UPS Store to send it back also. A brand new tool that obviously was defective from the factory and the inability of Amazon personnel to perform a simple replacement has left a bad feeling in this long time Amazon shopper.
customer_reviews.author: D. Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Decent drill for light-medium duty jobs.
customer_reviews.text: As a Biomedical equipment technician, this drill does the job for me. I work with electronic devices most of the time so I didn’t need anything heavy duty and expensive. This drill is great for electronic technicians or for light duty house work.
customer_reviews.author: Tony R.

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price but falls short on performance and design
customer_reviews.text: Good deal for the price. There are some odd things about this unit however that had I known I may have considered an alternate. It does not lock straight or at an angle which can cause the unit to transform on you mid use. The second thing seems to be with the low/high setting, if this is not fully engaged it will look like the unit is working but have absolutely no torque. Speaking of torque, the unit isn't that powerful even though it has torque settings I found it would not fully screw in a screw to some hard wood without pre-drilling.
customer_reviews.author: Chris H

customer_reviews.title: Not what I hoped Very underpowered
customer_reviews.text: It’s awkward to handle awkward controls and it’s very poor in power
customer_reviews.author: R. Profit

customer_reviews.title: Ordering a second, because it is awesome!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the Hitachi cordless screwdriver as a last ditch effort to save my job. Due to an injury my dominate wrist was fused and hardware installed. I am also unable to supinate my forearm, making turning a screwdriver almost impossible. The doctors and attorney advised me to apply for SSI. Long story short, I'm back at work. The screwdriver, on setting 1, will drive 2" deck screws into new power, and telephone poles, over and over again. 5 months, almost daily use, still going strong
customer_reviews.author: R. Harris

customer_reviews.title: A much better driver than whats available elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: I had this tool at my last job before I retired, and used it daily. I tried to find one for home finding it discontinued. Then I found it here and was happy to make the purchase. Lightweight with plenty of power to work on PC's or most anything daily, I like the clutch feature, I can dial it in for the small screws. Get it while you can.
customer_reviews.author: Retired Computer Tech

customer_reviews.title: It's not worth more than $25 and not good for delicate work
customer_reviews.text: If you plan to use this for electronics or delicate hobby type activities look elsewhere. It has a torque feature and overall feels decent in the hand but the actuator switch is on/off like a light switch. Built in light is also stupid, since it's not turned on by trigger rather a separate switch. You can Not ease into a screwing situation delicately either! Not sure why else you'd want something this small so for it's intended purpose I personally think it sucks overall.
customer_reviews.author: EggMcMuffin

customer_reviews.title: Pinnacle of Power Tools
customer_reviews.text: I needed a powered screwdriver for work. Cordless drills are too heavy, and this is lightweight. I work on electronics and this hobby grade tool is absolute perfection. I've never damaged anything as the torque ring adjusts this from delicate to a beast. The grip is extremely comfortable but be careful of the hinge as it can pinch you very angrily. The dual buttons are great. LED light is very dim but I like that it stays on with its own button instead of only turning on when you start spinning your bits. I cannot stress how much I love this product.
customer_reviews.author: InternetShopping

customer_reviews.title: Very nice tool. Value at this price!
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about this tool except for two small details. 1. It takes both hands to load a bit. You must open then insert. Like many others. My previous tool left the chuck open when you extracted the bit. 2. The light is somewhat dim and mis-aimed, but far better than no lamp at all. Overall I would buy this tool again!
customer_reviews.author: Dwfixer

customer_reviews.title: Really nice driver
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product and would highly recommend it to anyone. The only complaint I have is that there is no easy way to switch the driver on and off, you have to move your hand to push the power on and for forward and reverse. Not a deal breaker but one that I hope they improve on. It is a high-quality drill that I bought with low expectations, it has really impressed me and is in my go-to stable of tools that fill my garage. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: MRMAZ2510

customer_reviews.title: Handle does not stay in place
customer_reviews.text: The unit appears well built and looks good. The handle, however, does not stay in position, either straight or pistol in simple use - very loose. The finger guard at the joint looks like an afterthought so not to get pinched inadvertently when the handle shifts form straight to pistol because it is not locked in. I have other Hitachi tools that are designed and work well. Not this tool and I am returning it for refund.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph J

customer_reviews.title: BEST EVER!
customer_reviews.text: OK you have NO idea how sad I was when I dropped my original Hitachi in the wet bilge of a boat... When I found that Metabo had obviously purchased the design rights and began making this again - I was SOOOOO happy! I bought a few if them as gifts. Don't even THINK to waste you time on any other powered driver... this one takes the cake! Ease of use, battery last MONTHS and a quick drop and swap to the next battery.... SO perfect - Don't screw this driver up Metabo by changing much - same design, but please make it as quality and long lasting as possible, and I'll buy MORE.
customer_reviews.author: Team Ballew

customer_reviews.title: Like the driver but not the charger.
customer_reviews.text: I've used the driver a few times and I like it. What I don't like is that the two times I have used the charger it smells like it is burning. No smoke but I would not leave it unattended because of possible fire hazard. It is a little suspicious that the charger has a short guarantee. Charges fine but i have no confidence in the charger. And as far as I know, you can't buy another charger for these batteries. Would like some feedback from the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: Cbeat

customer_reviews.title: I should have done this years ago.
customer_reviews.text: I was swaping out electric switches and outlets for a room remodel. Instead of endless twisting and untwisting of screws manually, this little monster did it all without a change of battery. With enough control that I could get the last twist on with my manual screwdriver. Two thoughts while using; "Where have you been for the last 40 years", "Should I store this with one or two batteries in my tool pouch".
customer_reviews.author: NH Guy

customer_reviews.title: Great power screwdriver and a great value.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great screwdriver to have around the house. There are many times I don't need the power of an impact driver and I can't fit a drill where my handy hitachi is perfect. It comes with two batteries and a charger so you can screw all day and night. One of the things I think is great about this Hitachi is that it has a clutch adjustment so you don't have to worry about over-tightening your fasteners. When I was shopping for power screwdrivers I looked at Bosch, Dewalt, Ryobi, Black and Decker and Milwaukee and the Hitachi provided the best value for the money. Very pleased with this tool.
customer_reviews.author: James Lertora

customer_reviews.title: Great for right handed; left not so much
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Hold a charge for a long time. I don;t understand why this doesn't come with a phillips and a flathead bit. I had to pirate one from by other drill set. Good quality, but I wish the trigger was designed better. Only right handed people can use this, because your thumb operates the trigger. You could use your left and have your index/middle finger operate the trigger, but my wife is a leftie and he hates the design. So, if you're a righty, go for it.
customer_reviews.author: SpamOfDeath

customer_reviews.title: Your driver bits fall off very easily
customer_reviews.text: The driver itself works as it should. However, one major flaw of this driver is the loose hex bit connection (female). It is too loose and driver bits fall off very easily. You will find this problem when you put the supplemental bit that comes with the driver. I tried other brands (Bosch and Black & Decker), however, the results were the same. If this driver does not have this problem, I would give 5 stars for its price (less than half of Makita's), however, with this problem, I can only give 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Kazuya Terakado

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product. Great Value!
customer_reviews.text: I'm very glad that I did some research and purchased this cordless screwdriver. I love that it comes in a case and includes an extra battery. I've used it quite a few times and it's perfect for general light to medium duty work. The built in light is a big plus. I would have liked to see an LED battery life indicator, but I can live without it. The batteries charge quickly and have a reasonably long operating time.
customer_reviews.author: Roy Mis

customer_reviews.title: Quiet, smooth, and powerful
customer_reviews.text: This screwdriver is quiet, smooth, and very torquey for its size. It's very comfortable in the hand and the switch is in a great location (on the side). The unit will change from straight to pistol grip without pressing an interlock and the action is smooth. Unit came with 2 batteries, a charger, and a hard case. The LED light is switchable separately via push button (push on, push off). It's not very bright, but adds illumination in dark recesses to locate screws or holes.
customer_reviews.author: Broggyr

customer_reviews.title: Broke after one year
customer_reviews.text: This thing was pretty great until it wasn't. Yeah, the ergonomics aren't the best but the battery life was great. I mainly used this very light duty on Traxxas remote control cars. Trouble is the clutch broke after one year--it'll turn but with no power at all--and now I have to buy a different one. Such a waste of money and a huge bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Early Adopter

customer_reviews.title: Weak and short life
customer_reviews.text: Let me first mention the pros about this tool. The case, 2 batteries, the light on the tool, and its bending function. Now the cons, it looses power very fast and even with 2 batteries you will not get past 30 2" screws. Also the charger will not last more than a year it did not for me and I did not even drop or put it in any tough situations.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: No magnet to keep tips in the driver
customer_reviews.text: Headline says it all. Most of these cordless screwdrivers have a neodymium magnet to hold the bit into the driver but not this one. Why on earth did they skimp on that? I'm reaching into the dishwasher with one had to unscrew a phillips head and the tip keeps falling out and then makes its way down into the innards of the frigging dishwasher! Yeah, that's a colossal pain in the you know what. Other than that it's nice.
customer_reviews.author: B. Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Quit working after less than 1 hour of run time.
customer_reviews.text: While it worked, I really loved this product. I had it less than 2 months and it quit working; sounds like the clutch broke. Actual run-time was probable less than 1 hour. I'm beyond the 1 month return window, so now I need to deal with Hitachi for warranty service.
customer_reviews.author: Frank B.

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: As some one who does hundreds of terminations a day in control cabinets , this thing is awesome. Set the clutch and let it rip. Took some time to get use to the trigger being on the side , but in tight spaces it actually works out where it is. Light weight , battery last forever for what I'm using it for. Much easier to use than a 12 volt impact.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Little

customer_reviews.title: You dont get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: The unit is okay. Gets the job done but for the price I would simply buy a black and Decker similar one. I haven't used it for more than a week and the body of the unit is peeling off! I've been using this to drill in screws for cable clips and with little use the green rubber protection grip is already peeling off and excessively. I haven't had this issue with black and Decker tools and for what I paid for this unit I expected much better quality. Especially after reading all the great reviews. Apparently there is lifetime warranty on the body so I'll have to check that out of its an option.
customer_reviews.author: Chewy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to replace a panasonic ey503. These are very good. Battery lasts a long time. The light is nice, and these have much more torque.
customer_reviews.author: Rec

customer_reviews.title: Great for computer repairs/assembly
customer_reviews.text: I used this for doing computer assembly and repair. The settings I have for this tool is on "low". Having to unscrew and screw a lot of computers manually can be tiresome and slow. This electric screwdriver allows me to work fast and effortlessly. The battery life, for my used case scenario is excellent. I highly recommend this to everyone who does computer repairs. It won't damage your motherboard if you're careful enough.
customer_reviews.author: MarkUS

customer_reviews.title: Very good
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my Hitachi (same tool) that lasted for 13 years.
customer_reviews.author: CDawg1506

customer_reviews.title: A great tool
customer_reviews.text: This was the highest rated cordless screwdriver on a number of sites.. So, I bought it. It's perfect for standard duty screw driving, and drilling with the right attachment bits. Makes a GREAT guitar and bass string winder if you have one that fits into a screwdriver type bit collet. I love this tool.
customer_reviews.author: LHBassist

customer_reviews.title: This is awesome
customer_reviews.text: I bought this and have used it several times and it works great. It came with two batteries, charger and a plastic case and at a great price. I have to say it may be manly to turn a screw driver but I will finish and having a beer before you. It also has 21 torque settings so you don't strip threads, a drill setting, dual position, forward and reverse and a light (which came in very handy putting in my daughters AUX attachment in her car at dusk).
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: My mistake.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this tool for almost two years, but have used it very little. It is under-powered and will not drive or remove any but the smallest screws. The batteries do not hold their charge while the tool is in storage, and thus it is never ready to use when I need it. Now, only one battery works, and the charger does not. The tool looks good and the hype sounds good, but it is not worth what I paid, and certainly not what it costs now. I should have done more research before I purchased. . .
customer_reviews.author: JBaker

customer_reviews.title: Best screwdriver made
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 of these because my wife was always stealing it. Strong battery, strong screwdriver. This works great great for small and bigger projects. I’ve used it to change out hinges on door and cabinets, constantly use it for outlets and switches and have even done some small scale framing with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Fouse

customer_reviews.title: Great screwdriver with remarkable battery life.
customer_reviews.text: I have used the Hitachi version of this Screwdriver in my job as an electronics tech for more than 10 years. The Metabo model is the exact same model. The batteries and charger are interchangeable. I bought this one for my adult son, so he would quit borrowing mine
customer_reviews.author: M. Parr

customer_reviews.title: Won't cause a revolt
customer_reviews.text: Bought for a maintenance team and used frequently, this little driver has outperformed in every way. The battery is small but must have a little ener... bunny inside. The spare battery and charger means that there is never down-time. Torque control is nice and serves as a mini impact driver.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Le Royer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome drill with torque adjustment
customer_reviews.text: 2 years almost now. Tough and reliable. 2 batteries and case. My go to tool now. Torque adjustment is what sold me on this. I had a small red skill driver and it would constantly strip out screws. No longer with this. I would say this is the best small driver i have ever used. Batteries charge inabout an hour. And Last me 2weeks even be used every day as an tech with lots of screws to take of equipment. Quick chuck make ot easy, led on front is kinda dull but works when under a sink or closet. Its the best yet.
customer_reviews.author: Tony politi

customer_reviews.title: Great tool
customer_reviews.text: We bought one of these for use in the manufacturing facility, and we loved it so much I bought a second one for the house. They are great screwdrivers - but with the lower voltage, don't expect them to have the same driving power as a 18V impact driver. As long as your expectation is for a powered screwdriver, you'll love these.
customer_reviews.author: F. Christian

customer_reviews.title: as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Works great. A slight change in trigger placement differs from the old Hitachi unit. Also, at the high speed setting the motor does not turn as fast as the old Hitachi unit. It works fine though and I recommend it for servicing electronic devices where you have lots of small screws to remove and reinstall.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer DGD

customer_reviews.title: This is one awesome drill/driver at one heck of a price
customer_reviews.text: This is one awesome drill/driver at one heck of a price. They are the standard where I work. Reasonably priced workhorses. They smoke the Panasonic 3.6 volt at less than half the price. Comes with case, two batteries and quick charger. Light, and grip friendly. Ergonomic, good torque, accurate torque release, excellent battery time, quick charging. We've been using them for a good while now and out of over 50 in service only one has died. I recommend this because it is used in a production environment where high failure rates are unacceptable. They are a bench standard in light electronic, copier and computer applications.
customer_reviews.author: GoldtopSam

customer_reviews.title: Hitachi DB3DL2
customer_reviews.text: This Model DB3DL2 cordless screwdriver should definitely be labeled as light duty. I found it to be incapable of completely screwing in #8 screws even though the holes were predrilled. It should be fine for #7 screws or smaller. I do like the light weight of this screwdriver, and the lithium batteries recharge very quickly. Compared to other 3.6-volt screwdrivers I would rate this unit much higher than all others. But for my general use, I'll find it only occasionally useful. Bottom line is for light work, I'd rate it 5-stars. For anything remotely difficult to screw down, it like all other 3.6-volt cordless screwdrivers, I can't rate it nor them any of them better than a 3-star.
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: BEST VALUE SCREWGUN
customer_reviews.text: Does what other professional screw guns do but at half the price. I'll admit it definitely can't output the same torque as the Makita, but you should use a drill if you require more than 5 ft-lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Nope

customer_reviews.title: Light is not automatic and no trigger for "gun-like" use
customer_reviews.text: I usually buy the cheap $20 drivers that are disposable when the battery dies. I decided to step up. 1) the light should come on with each use, but does not. It is a separate switch and 2) there is no trigger like a normal 90 degree driver. On the cheap ones I've owned, the chuck was magnetic, so bits in and out easily, this is more positive, mechanical. Probably better that way.
customer_reviews.author: KFB

customer_reviews.title: great tool for the money
customer_reviews.text: The Metabo is well-made, lightweight, and ideal for replacing a manual screwdriver for light to medium duty applications. If you want it to replace a heavy duty tool, this isn't what you want. But if you want an easier way to drive screws and fasteners than using a screwdriver, this is it. It's much easier on the hands, arms, and shoulders due to the great power to weight factor. If you want to do heavy duty work then get a heavy duty tool but this is really nice for everything else.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: IT Necessity
customer_reviews.text: If you work on computers or electronics, give your wrist a break. This drill is the perfect size, great price, with uncompromising power, and two lithium ion batteries - the first of which I am still using after almost two months of use. One hesitation I had is the magnetized bits. They are useful to keep those buggers from falling and to keep an incoming screw steady, but in electronics it is very risky to use magnetized material due to the sensitive components such as hard drives. This can be overcome by purchasing a separate non-magnetized set by Hitachi. When I first got the unit, I folded it up and back down, and got a good pinch. Watch your fingers!
customer_reviews.author: Chris McCray

customer_reviews.title: Must for any person with a job like mine!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, what a great product! I work on office equipment for a living for the last 18 years and this saves my wrists after turning a screwdriver manually for that long! Love it way more than the cheap ryobi I owned for a year (and died). Comes with two batteries, charger, hard case and #2 phillips screw bit. Awesome with a store bought magnetic bit holder.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Rappard

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: Switch not handy for left handed in pistol grip. Straight better for lefties
customer_reviews.author: James P Jochum

customer_reviews.title: Lacks power!
customer_reviews.text: It’s just okay. Doesn’t have much power, good for loose screws. Was going to return, but time ran out on me. Save your money and get a more powerful compact driver.
customer_reviews.author: K. benford

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect for these days appliance repair
customer_reviews.text: Works perfect for these days appliance repair! ...where they keep switching from real metal to thigh it=brake it plastic parts :( Battery chargers very quickly !
customer_reviews.author: Eco Appliance Atlanta

customer_reviews.title: Reverse stopped working!
customer_reviews.text: My reverse no longer works. I can't find any info to return item. I hope someone will respond back to me.
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Incredible tool for the low price. Highly recommend it
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent cordless screwdriver for my hobby. Been racing RC cars since the 80’s and wish this was available then. I have to use it on slow and the drill setting which has a lot of torque to screw fresh screws into the plastic material with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: Jason M.

customer_reviews.title: he borrowed my Hitachi and was very pleased with the features and performance
customer_reviews.text: This is a very well made, lower cost electric screwdriver that is a copy of the more expensive Panasonic model. My electrician had been using a Panasonic for years. When his battery went dead, he borrowed my Hitachi and was very pleased with the features and performance. He said he could not tell the difference. Compare the specs and you will see for yourself, this is the one to get. It has lots of power and the battery lasts quite a long time. It has a spare battery and it charges very fast.
customer_reviews.author: P. Dugas

customer_reviews.title: Ergo nightmare
customer_reviews.text: Ended up returning it, it was OK. Great torque settings, bought to tear down computers. The flex handle is it's weakest part and they screwed in a rubber flap to keep people from getting pinched.
customer_reviews.author: CMDTech

customer_reviews.title: Wish I hadn't waited so long to buy this
customer_reviews.text: Not the cheapest tool by far but one that I know will last for years. Easy to configure as a pistol grip or straight-forward screwdriver, it's a no-brainer tool. Having two batteries is a definite plus. I really like the magnetic chuck, it accepts the various drivers and bits I already have.
customer_reviews.author: LarryLarry75

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRODUCT FOR DRIVING ALL KINDS OF SMALL BITS & SOCKETS
customer_reviews.text: Wow what a deal, I had to replace a six year old unit that I have to admit I used often in place of a drill so it literally broke in half. Without a doubt my most used battery tool. I use the various sizes of drill chucks to hold small drill bits & small sockets, etc., sometimes as a drimel tool. Oh I use it as a screw driver also.
customer_reviews.author: Riggster

customer_reviews.title: This is my go to. Best tool ever!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one after owning my first for close to 10 years. Very versatile, strong and easy to use. This should most definitely be in every handyman's tool bag. Hitachi can make some pretty cool tools, but not only they look good, they work very well also! Great buy.
customer_reviews.author: Archangel

customer_reviews.title: Good unit with two batteries - enough torque for home use.
customer_reviews.text: I like this. Didn't take long to get used to it. Love the way you achieve forward and reverse and that it comes with two batteries. It's not the strongest as far as torque goes, but for home use, it's plenty. If I were a professional handyman - I'd probably want something with a bit more torque. LED is another plus for this unit - so you can see what you are working on.
customer_reviews.author: Cage

customer_reviews.title: Best power screwdriver ever
customer_reviews.text: Great quality. Variety of settings for different power and speeds needs. Does everything from drilling a hole, to torquing a screw well. Case is nice, batteries have long life
customer_reviews.author: Reviews from a guy

customer_reviews.title: i use this exclusively for RC and skateboard assembly.
customer_reviews.text: excellent for RC coupled with MIP speed tips. also good for assembling skateboards. tighten in cross pattern on level 9 then tighten on drill setting until it releases tension. doesn't overtighten because of the relatively weak voltage compared to some of the competitors so it's good for light duty use like what i use it for.
customer_reviews.author: Jared M.Top Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Very weak, good for watch repair!
customer_reviews.text: Weeeaaaaak. Seriously! This thing pretty much maxes out at opening the battery box for my kids electric toys, or removing the screws from a wall plate, etc. Very very weak. I have a 20 year old craftsman that my dad got me when I was a kid that has better ergonomics (trigger vs awkward side switch), better light, and waaaay more torque - all for the same size gun. I guess it's like they say, "they don't make'em like they used to"
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Very well made
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this driver. Used mostly on computer builds. The built in clutch is fantastic. Well worth the money paid!
customer_reviews.author: Robert E. Baker

customer_reviews.title: Great  Product, no complaints, it does wah it should, and has a lot of power.
customer_reviews.text: Very nice, read all the reviews and they were correct, this cordless screw driver has a lot of power, and is easy to use. It feels well made, and comes in a nice case as well. I put a small chuck on it so it can handle small drill bits as well.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph M.

customer_reviews.title: No handle position lock... but otherwise perfect
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Quick charging, powerful motor, good battery life, accurate clutch. Control locations are good. Lockout switch so that the driver doesn't start and drain the battery when in a tool box or bag is well thought out. Negatives: This driver, along with many others of this same design from other manufacturers, does not have a lock to keep it in the straight extended position. The result is an occasion hand pinch when the handle moves. Add a lock to keep the driver either straight or in the gun shape and it would be perfect. As is it's only very, very good.
customer_reviews.author: ALF Engineer

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Screwdriver - I Love It
customer_reviews.text: Lost one of my B&D screwdrivers and needed to buy another one. Was looking at this one and the DeWalt, so I bought this one and put the DeWalt on my Christmas list and got that. They both are top-notch and have good reviews. My only complaint is that I feel the switch could be in a better position, but it is only a minor annoyance. Has good power and is a nice addition to my ever-expanding tool collection. Guys love these, so women, buy them one!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Schleis

customer_reviews.title: good screwdriver, not really designed for delicate screws and electronics
customer_reviews.text: the ergonomics are great on the hand, the power is fine for 3.6v, and the light is ok too. the only real problem with it is that it doesn't have gradual power shifting - you either press it on or of, and it's not good for delicate electronics\smarphones..
customer_reviews.author: Benaya Trabelsi

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the homeowner or handyman. I'd buy another as soon as needed.
customer_reviews.text: This is the handiest tool in my collection. It's much more versatile than my drill and can handle most light jobs easily. I rarely use my drill anymore. The price is the best out there. Similar products by Mikita and Milwaukee may provide longer duration and more driving power. I recommended it to a friend who bought one and is just as pleased.
customer_reviews.author: T-Square

customer_reviews.title: Great for R/C hobby
customer_reviews.text: I use this in concert with the Tekton 2841 screwdriver bit set to mainly work on my hobby grade R/C cars. This is also great for small projects around the house where a fullsize cordless drill may be overkill. The LED light's helpful and the 2-position handle is ergonomic. At first I wasn't too sure about the single speed motor, but after working with the delicate fasteners in my R/C cars, I don't have a problem with it. Just be sure to correctly set the clutch so you don't strip out the threads.
customer_reviews.author: CarlV

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: I work as a copier technician, this little drill gives no disappointments. Handles the work loads and the battery charges in less than an hour as it lasts for up to a week unless it gets heavy use. It comes with a spare battery which comes in handy between jobs.
customer_reviews.author: ulices

customer_reviews.title: Battery powered screwdriver
customer_reviews.text: This is a very high quality product that is perfect for situations where an electric drill is too big. Battery lasts a long time and the set comes with a charger and a strong case.
customer_reviews.author: Michael E. Little

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY - CHEAP IMITATION
customer_reviews.text: Not even close to the quality of the original Hitachi model. Do not waste your time ordering this. The batteries don’t last and the driver has no torque at all. Imitation garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Great handheld power screwdriver
customer_reviews.text: Great handheld power screwdriver. Wish the handle would lock in the two different positions. It has a friction hinge that sometimes does;t hold the angle (which is annoying). Otherwise, works well. Mine only cam with a phillips tip, so had to buy a pack of different "fast change" tips, which weren't expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: This is a really good product as a power screw driver
customer_reviews.text: This is a really good product as a power screw driver. It is not a real powerful drill and as a Handyman I do need a much more power unit to use as a drill. This one is light and has a light, it bends and works really well. It is Hitachi and as with all Hitachi products comes with a five year warrantee. This is my third one and when I had a problem some years ago I sent it back to Hitachi and they promptly send me a new one. It really is a very good product used properly.
customer_reviews.author: Marty G

customer_reviews.title: I like that it comes with an extra battery
customer_reviews.text: I haven't quite figured out how the torquing works, but I haven't broken or locked this up yet, as I have done with every other brand of cordless driver I've bought at this price level. I like that it comes with an extra battery, but find it annoying that it only comes with a phillips bit. Luckily, I have the bits that came with the other drivers. One thing I don't like is that there seems to be no lock on the bendy part, and it bends when I don't want it to.
customer_reviews.author: Captain Virago

customer_reviews.title: Must have for anybody's tool box
customer_reviews.text: I am very impressed with this product. Very powerful yet light to handle. Speaking of light,the light on this unit has a separate button which comes in very handy. High speed is just that very nice! One other nice plus, when I was purchasing this I was sure it said one battery. It does come with 2!!!!
customer_reviews.author: tecitout

customer_reviews.title: Really like, just wish the positions locked
customer_reviews.text: I agree with other posters. I wish there was a lock for the positions. It is easy to get my finger stuck, so I keep it out of the middle when changing the positions. It works very well. I got the Hitachi 115293 bit kit after I received the screwdriver.
customer_reviews.author: jennifer j.

customer_reviews.title: OK but there is competition out there.
customer_reviews.text: Overpriced in my opinion. But one has to assume it is the cost of the lifetime warranty. Don’t expect miracle torque. Would have liked to see a feature allowing the device to lock in its straight position.
customer_reviews.author: Urmuz

customer_reviews.title: perfect for every job
customer_reviews.text: We spent a little more after reading other reviews and this is worth every penny. Torque settings all work great, batteries hold charge and spare is sitting in the charger for heavy usage days. I have joint problems in wrists so use this for every job big and small. Get a variety of heads for every type, this only comes with #2 phillips and flat head. I broke the first one trying to over compensate a metal hole with a metal screw, and it was instantly replaced.
customer_reviews.author: Reafive

customer_reviews.title: And it does a good job when using to repair any of your electronic ...
customer_reviews.text: One of my co-worker has this Hitachi electric screwdriver. I had been looking at all of the Hardware stores for electric screwdriver. But I have never found any other electric screwdriver that was small compact, had pistol grip, very lightweight. And it does a good job when using to repair any of your electronic products. I have tried this screwdriver when I was rebuild my deck, but I found that it was not that strong with driving screwdrivers thru thick wood. But its great tool for smaller jobs.
customer_reviews.author: Al C.

customer_reviews.title: This is the screwdriver and drill we love and use.
customer_reviews.text: We were given one of these years ago. Best gift we have ever received. Love the small size, power and convenience of this tool. Good battery life too. When the old one finally died after 15+ years on a major fence repair, just wanted the same tool as a replacement. I would recommend a second battery. We like to have a spare one charged so our project is not interrupted.
customer_reviews.author: P. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great  Product  May Not be super strong but enough
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be good !! But seems also a lil weak but ... not the strongest
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Gray

customer_reviews.title: Glad to finally have a lithium ion power screwdriver
customer_reviews.text: Well made, fast delivery, outstanding value when compared to similar cordless screwdrivers. Glad to finally have a lithium ion power screwdriver. It always works when I need it. The lithium battery holds the charge for a long time. Every time I would go to use my old NiCad battery unit, it would be dead and I would have to charge it first. This lithium unit is always ready to go.
customer_reviews.author: Robert T. Burger

customer_reviews.title: Not what you see
customer_reviews.text: CPO Outlet sent me the rebranded Metabo which is the same tool but I was paying extra for the older discontinued Hitachi branded driver as advertised. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great power screw driver
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one I've bought. First one still works fine after 12 years....a battery died and I thought it was the charger. Buying the full set up was only $10 or so more than buying a charger. The new one has a few improvements and feels a little "tighter", but both work very well. Lots of torque...probably use it when I should pull out a drill, but opt for convenience and haven't broken it yet.
customer_reviews.author: Larry R. White

customer_reviews.title: Suitable for most orthopedic surgery
customer_reviews.text: Enough torque to back off seated fasteners, but adjustable enough to gently drive 12/32 machine screws. Articulating handle allows for use in spaces where a traditional cordless tool won't fit. Plenty of battery life for it's intended duty( no, it won't take lug nuts off your F-150). With accessories (magnetic screw holders, and drill Chuck) this driver is as versatile as a much larger cordless drill.
customer_reviews.author: FES

customer_reviews.title: FORGET BLACK & DECKER! THIS IS THE ONE YOU WANT RIGHT HERE
customer_reviews.text: Yup, this is indeed a 'great' little tool! To be honest, I was skeptical at first, because its a bit higher-priced than its competitors, but its well worth the added cost. Its designed by Hitachi of Japan and made in China, but its superior in build quality to anything else out there. You get the relatively small driver itself with two batteries (thumbs up!), plus the charger, and the Li-Ion battery design alone sets it apart. Five stars!
customer_reviews.author: Wingnut

customer_reviews.title: no guts no glory
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product for home use and repairs. I really like the two positions you can use, but I am very disappointed in the lack of power. Drilling, even in soft wood, is simply beyond the capability of this tool. It is very rare that I can drive a screw all the way in. I usually have to finish with a regular screwdriver. I had to loosen the screws before I could use this driver to take down our blinds. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Fred P.

customer_reviews.title: The best I have ever used
customer_reviews.text: This power screwdriver is the best quality and performance I have ever used
customer_reviews.author: Robert Seigfried

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool !
customer_reviews.text: Ive been using this for about 3 months and my brother has been using his for about 1 year. We are both residential electricians and use them tons trimming out a house putting outlets in and covers on them. The little light on it comes in handy alot and the batteries last a decent amount of time depending on how much your using it. Also its much lighter than other ones ive used which is nice because i carry it in my tool belt! All in all i would reccommend this for little use around the house OR daily use in a trade!
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Not impressed
customer_reviews.text: Decent power but not nearly what most reviews said it has. There is also an annoying rubber sleeve of some sort that gets in the way of using it easily.
customer_reviews.author: Tested

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Top notch, but slower than the Black and Decker. However, this was tow batteries and you can swap them easily. Best buy on the market today that I know of. 25 years ago there was one on the market smaller and way faster. Naturally, they went belly up.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Kunzman

product_meta.title: Hitachi DB3DL2 Power Cordless Screwdriver Kit, 3.6V 1.5Ah Lithium Ion Battery - 2, Dual Position, LED Light, Lifetime Tool Warranty (Discontinued by the Manufacturer)
product_meta.description:
Style:Hitachi DB3DL2The Hitachi DB3DL2 3.6 Volt 1/4 Inch Hex Drive Screwdriver is lightweight and powerful, and is perfect for tradesmen and contractors. Underneath a sink or in between cabinets, this drill fits in most spaces and is ideal for woodworking and home improvement. The DB3DL2 Screwdriver is powered by a 1.5 amp hour lithium ion battery and has 3 times the battery life of traditional batteries. Dual position handle converts from straight to pistol grip for added versatility. This product features a max lock torque of 44 pounds, a spindle lock mechanism and an adjustable clutch with 21 stage torque. In cabinets or underneath sinks, the built in LED light provides superior visibility and is perfect for unlit closets. The DB3DL2 includes (2) 1.5 amp hour, 3.6 Volt lithium ion batteries, a quick charger, a Phillips bit and a storage case. The Hitachi DB3DL2 3.6 Volt 1/4 Inch Hex Drive Screwdriver comes with a lifetime lithium ion tool warranty and a 2 year lithium ion battery warranty. Every Hitachi cordless power tool is designed to the highest standards and is rigorously tested for both performance and durability. Hitachi Power Tools (Hitachi Koki USA, Ltd.) provides professional grade power tools for a variety of applications, including woodwork, metalwork, concrete, drilling, cutting, and fastening. Since its inception, Hitachi has pioneered innovative technologies that have improved the quality of craftsmanship worldwide. Hitachi is a leader in power tool research and development and has achieved many firsts in the power tool industry. Today, Hitachi continues the tradition of innovation and engineering with new features in addition to classic quality.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The Hitachi DB3DL2 Lithium-Ion 3.6-Volt Cordless Screw Driver features improved circuit protection to keep its motor running longer in a newly designed tool body with an improved LED light. The DB3DL2 comes equipped with an exchangeable 3.6-Volt Lithium-Ion battery system for a steady level of power, 3-times longer battery life and 50-percent lighter weight compared to traditional NiCad batteries. It features a 1/4-inch hex chuck for quick and easy bit replacements, convertible tool body conforming from straight to pistol grip as needed and a compact, lightweight size that makes this versatile tool easy to use. This screwdriver can generate no-load speeds ranging from 200 to 600-RPM. It also offers 21 clutch settings to drive screws flush into wood or drywall and has a spindle lock for manually tightening screws, as well as an easy to use forward/reverse switch to change bit direction with the push of a button. It's powered by 1.5-amp-hour Lithium-Ion battery for fade free power (two included). The 1/4-inch hex chuck is used for quick bit changes. Built-in LED light to illuminate the work surface. This screw driver is compact and lightweight, measuring 10.55-inches long and weighing less than 1-pound (0.9-pound). Overload and over-discharge circuit protection offer high durability. The Hitachi DB3DL2 Lithium-Ion 3.6-Volt Cordless Screw Driver comes with a lifetime Lithium-Ion tool warranty and a 2-year Lithium-Ion battery warranty. Hitachi Power Tools provides professional-grade power tools for a variety of applications, including woodwork, metalwork, concrete, drilling, cutting and fastening. Hitachi is a leader in power tool research and development and has achieved many firsts in the power tool industry. Today, Hitachi continues the tradition of innovation and engineering with new features in addition to classic quality.
